intro: Gymnostoma papuanum, commonly known as the Papuan gymnostoma, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of New Guinea. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems. Its leaves are typically narrow and have a glossy surface. Gymnostoma papuanum is often found in humid, shaded environments and plays a role in the ecological balance of its habitat.
